narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: asynchronous, independent study for senior thesis
Zoom Calls with advisor
Independent study with consultations with faculty advisor
Zoom meetings with thesis advisor
Advisor meetings done via Zoom
Virtual meetings with thesis advisor
Remote, self-directed learning with an advisor.
Research on my own.
Zoom meetings with my advisor about every other week

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned more about my thesis topic and was able to dive deeply into the literature. I also learned how to more skillfully craft history essays.
Time management and working on long-term projects.
I gained a lot of knowledge about my thesis topic.

Professor Hansen guided me through the beginning stages of my senior thesis project, and I conducted most of my research during this semester. I also built the skeleton of my paper, including the outline and introduction.
I feel more confident in taking on a project of this size.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The strengths are that it is self-paced, and you can work with your advisor to decide deadlines. I cant think of any weaknesses.
Thesis
I wish that our senior thesis was an actual class that taught us to write a thesis like some of the other majors.

I feel like this course could have had a little more guidance in terms of what was expected for our assignments. I was mainly going off of the short assignment descriptions given in the senior handbook or asking questions of my advisor. Having a better description of a prospectus or secondary literature review, for example, would have been extremely helpful.

The course has pushed me to be extremely accountable to myself, and to have a lot of self-control when it comes to meeting my own deadlines and making sure that such a long-term project was on the right track. Because of this, I've found that this course has pushed me to become the leader of my own project, and that's taught me many valuable lessons.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This course was already well-adapted for virtual learning, as it is an independent-study course. The only challenge was being able to access physical material at the Beinecke and through the library system given hour restrictions. I think the only solution to that would be digitizing as many items in the Beinecke as possible, which I know they are working on!
All good
N/A
Not much could've been improved! I still had bi-weekly Zoom meetings with my advisor, and sometimes my co-advisee, and I felt very supported all throughout this process.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes. Its a required course for any HSHM senior doing a two-semester thesis, but it was well organized and I enjoyed it.
Thesis
I definitely would. Writing an undergraduate thesis is an unforgettable, extremely rewarding experience, and also lots of fun, especially if you focus on a topic that you're passionate about.
